title: I Am Your Life
presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8 v9 v10 v11

v1: I don't know how to follow You my Lord.
How can I run this racecourse to the end?
The darkness swells and covers me around;
My precious faith no longer clear to me.
v2: I hear Your voice, it calls me to Yourself;
I see Your hand, it draws me to Your rest;
Yet mountains high keep me from drawing nigh;
How can I run the journey to the end.
v3: My sorrow, can it really touch Your heart?
Does my soft prayer move You to tenderness?
Do drops of tears drop to Your inmost part?
Such helplessness, it occupies my heart.
v4: Where did the promised consecration fail?
What made the sweetness in my mind depart?
Such joy and hope— just precious memories,
O Lord, You are within this saddened heart.
v5: O Lord, have You forsaken me fore'er,
Or am I disappointed in Your lead?
Surely such sorrow only feels deep pain;
Can I trust You as You know what I am?
v6: So full of tears trickling before Your face;
My feeble songs, I see no smiling face.
Your harshest blows, they break me to the core;
Yet nail-scarred hands are hands of love the more.
v7: Can You revive my spirit, Lord, again?
Can You rekindle love so deep within?
This was Your promise and Your calling true,
Your inspiration and Your word of love.
v8: I cannot trust, yet still I trust in You;
I cannot cling, yet clinging closely still;
You never failed me, not one day or year,
Your faithfulness is shown in my pursuit.
v9: No faith, no word or feeling in my heart;
All darkness, hardness, and reducing too;
This is the pathway You ordained for me,
That in my life, I only You possess.
v10: And now I know, You're my experience;
What all seemed loss, was so to gain You more
Everything gone, now I am one with You;
Where there's no way, I see You testified.
v11: I sigh in love—I see Your hand of love;
I sweetly muse—You've stripped me throughout life;
You lead me into seeming hopelessness,
Then whispering to me: "I am your life."
